message: Now that iPad 2 has been announced, which version would you buy? Do the front and rear camera's make you want to wait for next week or the extra $100 off make it worth staying with the original?
Ew I'll wait for my playbook first thanks... But I recommend you grab the iPad 1 2nd hand for super cheap once the 2nd comes out
No apps on playbook or competitors. wait until they have happs. with the ipad 2, you get more software updates. i say ipad 2.
And if you are waiting on a playbook, you will be disappointed. Blackberry hasn't made a good OS yet, what makes you think it will change?
Why would anyone go with 1) a deprecated product (e.g. iPad 1) or 2) an inferior one (all other iPad-attempts)??
for the $100, I would go with the best. The dual-core, lighter weight. Not to mention those smart covers.
i have the iPad and would def recomend getting the new one cause the ipad I is a joke..no cam... no usb port... cant play flash... sucks

According to Gazelle it would cost me $200 to make the switch from old to new and require a new case which is required if you carry it in a backpack.  I don't facetime and the back camera doesn't even compare with the iphone.  HDMI out isn't a great draw, airplay works fine plus who would want to tie up their ipad while sitting on the couch where it gets the most use.  I'll wait for the new one.
I'm on the fence. I don't like the lower quality camera (not the same as iPhone 4) and the 3g instead of 4g.
9x graphics 2x cpu is enough to make me pony up a little extra for the 2.
...time at my laptop, and I don't miss the retina display or FaceTime. I think the iPad 1 would fit just fine.

You also have to bring into account that the iPad 2 is running Apple's new processor, the A5. It's bringing about 9 times the performance of the iPad, so if gaming is your thing I say go for the iPad 2.

...crap. Anyway, I was reading about smartphones for a year or two, really, and had the G1 for a few days back when it came out. Then, last summer, I ditched Verizon and bought the 3GS. I haven't looked around since. It's perfectly capable, has allowed me to spend much less
Not sure what the prospects are for buying an iPad, but I wouldn't overlook the iPad 1. I was reading reviews for smart

Saying the playbook will fail is like saying that OS X will die. It's not going to happen anytime soon. The PlayBook brings a lot to the table, it's multitasking is to die for (I had two HD Movies and a game all PLAYING in the background with no lag, not paused; at TED.) Personally, I'm waiting for HP's tablet, the TouchPad. Flash Support, dual core 1.2 GHz Snapdragon, 1 Gig RAM. It's going to be a fun device.
Nah, I already have the 1st gen. iPad. I think I'll skip the gen2 and use the gen1 until gen3 comes out. BTW, if you plan n

BTW, if you plan on swapping your gen1 iPad for the iPad 2, remember to swap the dock or keyboard dock, too, in case you've bought one. Looks like there's a new dock for the iPad 2, which is apparently slightly different.
